intro: Clitandra seretii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and attractive, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by oval, woody fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated for reforestation and ornamental purposes.
